headline: Campy Horror In Living Color
abstract: Classic films by Roger Corman and Michael Curtiz are part of the MoMA festival of preservation, To Save and Project.
lead_paragraph: Newly restored, Roger Corman’s riotously colorful adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe’s “The Masque of the Red Death” (1964) and Michael Curtiz’s shimmering pink-and-green “Mystery of the Wax Museum” (1933) are as gaudy as the day they opened — if not as scary.
keywords: The Masque of the Red Death (Movie)
